article_title: Walker to replace Coble; Price, Ellmers return to Congress
article_text:
By Times-News

Posted Nov. 4, 2014 at 12:01 AM

Updated Nov 4, 2014 at 10:31 PM

article_metadata.description: The 6th U.S. House District, represented for 30 years by Howard Coble, remains in Republican hands after Tuesday’s election. Meanwhile, incumbents retained their seats in Districts 2 and 4.    	    	     	WITH 86 PERCENT of 6th District precincts reporting, Republican Mark Walker defeated Democrat Laura Fjeld 59 percent to 41 percent. In Alamance County, Walker had 64 percent of the vote to 36 percent for Fjeld.    	Walker, 45, is an ordained minister from Greensboro who wants to
